channel.title: Publications on Jhony Kaesemodel Pontes
channel.description: Recent content in Publications on Jhony Kaesemodel Pontes

item.title: Deep level sets: Implicit surface representations for 3D shape inference
Learning free-form deformations for 3D object reconstruction
item.description: Overview Given a single image, our method uses a CNN to infer free-form deformation (FFD) parameters $\Delta \mathbf{P}$ (red arrows) for multiple templates $T$ (middle meshes). The $\Delta \mathbf{P}$ parameters are then used to deform the template vertices to infer a 3D mesh for each template (right meshes). Trained only with surface-sampled point-clouds, the model learns to apply large deformations to topologically different templates to produce inferred meshes with similar surfaces.

item.title: Image2Mesh: A learning framework for single image 3D reconstruction
item.description: Overview Given a single image, our framework employs a convolutional autoencoder to extract the image’s latent space, $\mathbf{z}$, that is used to classify it to an index, $c$, using a multi-label classifier and regress it to a compact shape parametrization using a feedforward network. We use a graph embedding, $\mathcal{G}$, that compactly represents 3D mesh objects to reconstruct the 3D model. Firstly, the estimated index, $c$, selects the closest 3D model to the image from the graph.

item.title: Compact model representation for 3D reconstruction
item.description: Example of a 3D CAD model being fit to a single image using our FFD anchor registration and silhouette fitting. Example of our 3D reconstruction from a single image. Please check the supplementary material out for more examples. [1] C. Kong, C-H. Lin and S. Lucey, Using Locally Corresponding CAD Models for Dense 3D Reconstructions from a Single Image, CVPR 2017.

item.title: Two-stage facial age prediction using group-specific features
A flexible hierarchical approach for facial age estimation based on multiple features
